reference.title: Configuration properties
reference.shortdesc: The DITA-OT uses .properties files and internal properties that store configuration settings for the toolkit and its plug-ins. Configuration properties are available to both Ant and Java processes, but unlike argument properties, they cannot be set at run time.

section.p: When DITA-OT starts the Ant process, it looks for property values in the following order and locations:

ol.li: Any property passed to Ant from the command line with -Dproperty or --property=value
A custom property file passed with --propertyfile
A local.properties file in the root directory of the DITA-OT installation

section.p: If a given property is set in multiple places, the first value “wins” and subsequent entries for the same property are ignored.
You can use this mechanism to override DITA-OT default settings for your environment by passing parameters to the dita command with --property=value, or using entries in .properties files.
